children.name: according
children.sourceText: And I, Enos, knew it would be according to the covenant which he had made; wherefore my soul did rest.

children.name: a
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: about
children.sourceText: And now it came to pass that I, Enos, went about among the people of Nephi, prophesying of things to come, and testifying of the things which I had heard and seen.

children.name: above
children.sourceText: And I have declared it in all my days, and have rejoiced in it above that of the world.

children.name: after
children.sourceText: And after I, Enos, had heard these words, my faith began to be unshaken in the Lord; and I prayed unto him with many long strugglings for my brethren, the Lamanites.

children.name: all
children.sourceText: And my soul hungered; and I kneeled down before my Maker, and I cried unto him in mighty prayer and supplication for mine own soul; and all the day long did I cry unto him; yea, and when the night came I did still raise my voice high that it reached the heavens.

children.name: among
children.sourceText: And now it came to pass that I, Enos, went about among the people of Nephi, prophesying of things to come, and testifying of the things which I had heard and seen.

children.name: an
children.sourceText: And it came to pass that I began to be old, and an hundred and seventy and nine years had passed away from the time that our father Lehi left Jerusalem.

children.name: and
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: any
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: at
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: before
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: between
children.sourceText: And I saw wars between the Nephites and Lamanites in the course of my days.

children.name: but
children.sourceText: But our labors were vain; their hatred was fixed, and they were led by their evil nature that they became wild, and ferocious, and a blood-thirsty people, full of idolatry and filthiness; feeding upon beasts of prey; dwelling in tents, and wandering about in the wilderness with a short skin girdle about their loins and their heads shaven; and their skill was in the bow, and in the cimeter, and the ax.

children.name: by
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: concerning
children.sourceText: Behold, I went to hunt beasts in the forests; and the words which I had often heard my father speak concerning eternal life, and the joy of the saints, sunk deep into my heart.

children.name: could
children.sourceText: And I, Enos, knew that God could not lie; wherefore, my guilt was swept away.

children.name: down
children.sourceText: And my soul hungered; and I kneeled down before my Maker, and I cried unto him in mighty prayer and supplication for mine own soul; and all the day long did I cry unto him; yea, and when the night came I did still raise my voice high that it reached the heavens.

children.name: for
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: from
children.sourceText: I say there was nothing short of these things, and exceedingly great plainness of speech, would keep them from going down speedily to destruction.

children.name: he
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: him
children.sourceText: And my soul hungered; and I kneeled down before my Maker, and I cried unto him in mighty prayer and supplication for mine own soul; and all the day long did I cry unto him; yea, and when the night came I did still raise my voice high that it reached the heavens.

children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: in
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: into
children.sourceText: Behold, I went to hunt beasts in the forests; and the words which I had often heard my father speak concerning eternal life, and the joy of the saints, sunk deep into my heart.

children.name: it
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: many
children.sourceText: And after I, Enos, had heard these words, my faith began to be unshaken in the Lord; and I prayed unto him with many long strugglings for my brethren, the Lamanites.

children.name: me
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: might
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: mine
children.sourceText: And my soul hungered; and I kneeled down before my Maker, and I cried unto him in mighty prayer and supplication for mine own soul; and all the day long did I cry unto him; yea, and when the night came I did still raise my voice high that it reached the heavens.

children.name: must
children.sourceText: And I saw that I must soon go down to my grave, having been wrought upon by the power of God that I must preach and prophesy unto this people, and declare the word according to the truth which is in Christ.

children.name: my
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: nothing
children.sourceText: And many of them did eat nothing save it was raw meat; and they were continually seeking to destroy us.

children.name: of
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: on
children.sourceText: And I rejoice in the day when my mortal shall put on immortality, and shall stand before him; then shall I see his face with pleasure, and he will say unto me:

children.name: our
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: out
children.sourceText: Now, it came to pass that when I had heard these words I began to feel a desire for the welfare of my brethren, the Nephites; wherefore, I did pour out my whole soul unto God for them.

children.name: save
children.sourceText: And many of them did eat nothing save it was raw meat; and they were continually seeking to destroy us.

children.name: shall
children.sourceText: And I soon go to the place of my rest, which is with my Redeemer; for I know that in him I shall rest.

children.name: should
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: so
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: some
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: that
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: the
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: their
children.sourceText: And they swore in their wrath that, if it were possible, they would destroy our records and us, and also all the traditions of our fathers.

children.name: them
children.sourceText: Now, it came to pass that when I had heard these words I began to feel a desire for the welfare of my brethren, the Nephites; wherefore, I did pour out my whole soul unto God for them.

children.name: there
children.sourceText: And there came a voice unto me, saying:

children.name: these
children.sourceText: Now, it came to pass that when I had heard these words I began to feel a desire for the welfare of my brethren, the Nephites; wherefore, I did pour out my whole soul unto God for them.

children.name: they
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: this
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: thus
children.sourceText: And while I was thus struggling in the spirit, behold, the voice of the Lord came into my mind again, saying:

children.name: to
children.sourceText: Behold, I went to hunt beasts in the forests; and the words which I had often heard my father speak concerning eternal life, and the joy of the saints, sunk deep into my heart.

children.name: unto
children.sourceText: And my soul hungered; and I kneeled down before my Maker, and I cried unto him in mighty prayer and supplication for mine own soul; and all the day long did I cry unto him; yea, and when the night came I did still raise my voice high that it reached the heavens.

children.name: up
children.sourceText: And there was nothing save it was exceeding harshness, preaching and prophesying of wars, and contentions, and destructions, and continually reminding them of death, and the duration of eternity, and the judgments and the power of God, and all these things, stirring them up continually to keep them in the fear of the Lord.

children.name: upon
children.sourceText: But our labors were vain; their hatred was fixed, and they were led by their evil nature that they became wild, and ferocious, and a blood-thirsty people, full of idolatry and filthiness; feeding upon beasts of prey; dwelling in tents, and wandering about in the wilderness with a short skin girdle about their loins and their heads shaven; and their skill was in the bow, and in the cimeter, and the ax.

children.name: us
children.sourceText: And they swore in their wrath that, if it were possible, they would destroy our records and us, and also all the traditions of our fathers.

children.name: wherefore
children.sourceText: And I, Enos, knew that God could not lie; wherefore, my guilt was swept away.

children.name: which
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: while
children.sourceText: And while I was thus struggling in the spirit, behold, the voice of the Lord came into my mind again, saying:

children.name: will
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.

children.name: with
children.sourceText: And after I, Enos, had heard these words, my faith began to be unshaken in the Lord; and I prayed unto him with many long strugglings for my brethren, the Lamanites.

children.name: would
children.sourceText: And now behold, this was the desire which I desired of him that if it should so be, that my people, the Nephites, should fall into transgression, and by any means be destroyed, and the Lamanites should not be destroyed, that the Lord God would preserve a record of my people, the Nephites; even if it so be by the power of his holy arm, that it might be brought forth at some future day unto the Lamanites, that, perhaps, they might be brought unto salvation, For at the present our strugglings were vain in restoring them to the true faith.

children.name: ye
children.sourceText: Come unto me, ye blessed, there is a place prepared for you in the mansions of my Father.

children.name: yea
children.sourceText: And my soul hungered; and I kneeled down before my Maker, and I cried unto him in mighty prayer and supplication for mine own soul; and all the day long did I cry unto him; yea, and when the night came I did still raise my voice high that it reached the heavens.

children.name: you
children.sourceText: Behold, it came to pass that I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man, for he taught me in his language, and also in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, and blessed be the name of my God for it, And I will tell you of the wrestle which I had before God, before I received a remission of my sins.
